metadata.title: "Coyote's Journey"
metadata.author: Julia Starritt
metadata.publication: William Bright, The Karok Language (1957), pp. 176-181, Text 4

s.kar:
pihnêefich
uum
ishpuk éekyav
t óo
thvoonha .
s.eng: Coyote wanted to make money.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
kahyúras
tá
ni vâaram ,
ishpúk
tá
ni kyáar ."
s.eng: And he said, "I'm leaving for Klamath Lakes, I'm going to make money."

s.kar:
xás
u 'árihroov ,
u pakurîihvu tih .
s.eng: And he went upriver, he was singing.

s.kar:
"
kahyúras
ni vâaram eesh ,
ishpúk
ni kyâar eesh ."
s.eng: "I'll leave for Klamath Lakes, I'll go make money."

s.kar:
xás
vúra
yíiv
káruk
t u 'árihroov .
s.eng: And he went a long ways upriver.

s.kar:
xás
kâam
ú troovu tih .
s.eng: And he looked upriver.

s.kar:
káan
ípaha
u 'íihya .
s.eng: A tree stood there.

s.kar:
yánava
itráhyar
akváat
kun 'irukûuntakoo .
s.eng: He saw ten raccoons sitting.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
yéehe
yôotva .
s.eng: And he said, "Well, hurray!

s.kar:
poorá piit
ni kyâa vish
káru
vúra
nani voonvánaach
káru
akvákir
káru
vúra
nani yukúkuh ."
s.eng: I'll make new pants and my shirt and a quiver and my shoes."

s.kar:
xás
u pixivshúroo
pa mú saanva .
s.eng: And he ripped off his clothes.

s.kar:
xás
u 'ixaxáxax
vúra
tûupichas .
s.eng: And he tore them into little pieces.

s.kar:
xás
sáruk
u xyáfak oo .
s.eng: And he threw them downhill.

s.kar:
xás
íishkar
u p ihyárihish .
s.eng: And he stood naked.

s.kar:
xás
kári
ta'ítam "
chími
kan kúniihk i ,"
hínupa
páy
t óo
kfíripriv .
s.eng: And then (he said), "Let me shoot (one)," but he missed.

s.kar:
xás
p aakváat
sáruk
u skákunih .
s.eng: And the raccoon jumped downhlll.

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
vúra
yíth
u kúniihka .
s.eng: And he shot at another one.

s.kar:
kúkuum
vúra
uum
u skákunih .
s.eng: It too jumped down.

s.kar:
xás
koovúra
t oo
kfíriprin .
s.eng: And he missed them all.
s.note: Going by Bright's rules, we expect that "too" should be accented here, but we have left it unaccented just in case the lack of accent is not a typo in Bright.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
kâarim
t óo
pmahóonkoon .
s.eng: Then he felt bad.

s.kar:
xás
sâam
u kfúkunih .
s.eng: And he crept downhill.

s.kar:
xás
u p ífik
koovúra
pa mu sanveeshxaxáxax .
s.eng: And he picked up his torn-up clothes.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
u piptákith v aheen .
s.eng: And then he mended them.

s.kar:
xás
íp
táay
áan
u sáanvu tih at ,
káruma
vaa
íp
u vúpar eesh at
pa mú spuk .
s.eng: He was carrying a lot of thread, that's what he was going to string his money with.

s.kar:
xás
u pasasîip .
s.eng: And he put his clothes on.

s.kar:
xás
u 'árihroov .
s.eng: And he traveled upriver.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t óo
xúriha .
s.eng: And he got hungry.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
káan
uxráa
t óo
mtup .
s.eng: And he saw berries ripe there.

s.kar:
xás
u 'áam va .
s.eng: And he ate them.

s.kar:
yánava
káan
u 'íinva hi tih .
s.eng: He saw there was a forest fire there.

s.kar:
yánava
vúra
táay
pá xaath
t óo
mtupíshriih va ,
xás
vúra
amáyav
kunish .
s.eng: He saw lots of grasshoppers cooked, and they were sort of good-tasting.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
u 'aam v áheen .
s.eng: And so he ate them.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
taay
u 'av .
s.eng: And he ate a whole lot.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
hûutva
t u 'iin ,
púxay
ta'ítam
yâavahi tih ara .
s.eng: But what was the matter with him? he wasn't getting full.

s.kar:
xás
ífuthkam
kúuk
u p itvûu tih .
s.eng: And he looked behind him.

s.kar:
yánava
pá xaath
vaa
vúra
u kupa 'íshipithun ahi ti
p oo kupa vúrayv ahi tih een .
s.eng: He saw the grasshoppers strung around where he had been wandering.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
u turáayv aheen .
s.eng: So then he looked around.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
káan
axvaha 'ípaha
u 'íihya .
s.eng: And he saw a pitch tree standing there.

s.kar:
yánava
axvahá taay .
s.eng: He saw there was a lot of pitch.

s.kar:
xás "
chími
kan ip shivsháp vaan i ."
s.eng: So (he said), "Let me plug myself up."

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
u 'ípav .
s.eng: Then he ate again.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
chéemyaach
u yâavaha .
s.eng: And he quickly got full.

s.kar:
xás
axmáy
vúra
u thítiv
ishnur .
s.eng: And suddenly he heard thundering.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
hôoy
vúra
kumee thívthaaneen
u snúru tih ."
s.eng: And he said, "It's thundering somewhere in the country."

s.kar:
xás
axmáy
vúra "
anoo !
anoo !
tá
née mchak ."
s.eng: And suddenly (he said), "Ouch! ouch! I'm burnt!"
s.note: Bright: "anoo! 'ouch!' is used when a person is burned. Other types of pain occasion the response akee!"

s.kar:
xás
u pitvâavraa .
s.eng: He looked back over (his shoulder).

s.kar:
yánava "
tá
ná 'iinka ."
s.eng: He saw, (he said), "I'm burning!"

s.kar:
xás
âapun
u kyívish ,
xás
u krivrúhuthun .
s.eng: And he fell to the ground, and he rolled about.

s.kar:
xás
ú msip
pá 'aah .
s.eng: Then the fire went out.

s.kar:
xás
kári
u pvâaram ,
xás
vúra
u 'ípahoo .
s.eng: So then he went off again, and he traveled again.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
xára
u 'áhoo .
s.eng: And he traveled a long time.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
íshaha
t óo
xra
puxich .
s.eng: And he got very thirsty.

s.kar:
xás
pa mú prii
vúra
puxích
t u váxrah .
s.eng: His tongue was very dry.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
káan
ikmaháchraam
u 'íikra .
s.eng: And he saw a sweathouse standing there.

s.kar:
xás
yanava
káan
ára
u píkniihvu tih ,
u pakurîihvu tih .
s.eng: And he saw a person was sweating himself there, he was singing.
s.note: We expect yanava to be accented as yánava, but we have kept it unaccented here just in case the lack of accent is not a typo in Bright.</note

s.kar:
káruma
vúra
t u thapáxrah .
s.eng: (Coyote) was terribly thirsty.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
káan
axak 'ásip
axrát 'aas
u tháthriin .
s.eng: And he saw two baskets of berry juice sitting there.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
yôotva ,
nâach ish
mu 'íshaha
chí
ni 'ísh eesh .
s.eng: And he said, "Hurray, I'll drink nephew's juice!

s.kar:
chími
chîimich
vúra
kan pakatkâa tih ."
s.eng: Let me just taste a little."

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
vúra "
xâatik
vúra
kumatêeshich
kan 'îish i ."
s.eng: And again (he said), "Let me drink a little more."

s.kar:
xás
áxak
vúra
pa 'ásip
u 'íshfip .
s.eng: And he drank up both bowls.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
náach ish ,
xáyfaat
ík
vúra
nee xviphûunish ."
s.eng: Then he said, "Nephew, you mustn't get angry at me!"

s.kar:
xás
kári
u 'árihroov .
s.eng: And he traveled upriver.

s.kar:
xás
pa mú naath
u 'árihrupuk .
s.eng: Then his "nephew" came outdoors.

s.kar:
xás
u xús "
chí
kan 'îish i ."
s.eng: And he thought, "Let me drink!"

s.kar:
xás
yánava
pa 'ásip
áruun
kun iphíriv .
s.eng: And he saw the baskets lying empty.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
yáxa
áta
uum
pa pihneefich 'îin
tá
na sítviik .
s.eng: And he said, "Look, I'll bet Coyote stole it from me.

s.kar:
kínikini
vúra
uum
u vaxrahchák eesh .
s.eng: Let him die of thirst!

s.kar:
xáyfaat
ík
vúra
íshaha
u mah .
s.eng: He mustn't find any water.

s.kar:
koovúra
ík
pa 'íshaha
u váxraah vunaa vish ."
s.eng: All the water must dry up."

s.kar:
xás
pihnêefich
u 'árihroov .
s.eng: And Coyote traveled upriver.

s.kar:
xás
íshaha
t óo
xrah .
s.eng: And he got thirsty.

s.kar:
xás
vaa
vúra
u 'áhoo tih .
s.eng: But he just kept traveling.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
puxích
t óo
xrah ,
xás "
chími
íshaha
kan 'îish i ."
s.eng: Then he got very thirsty, and (he thought) "Let me drink water!"

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
u pátumkurih een .
s.eng: So he put his mouth down to the water.

s.kar:
xás
ámtaap
kích
ú kpuupvar
apmaan .
s.eng: And just dust puffed into his mouth.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
pa 'íshaha
sáruk
t u vúunfak .
s.eng: And he saw the water flowing away downhill.

s.kar:
xás
u 'áharam .
s.eng: So he chased it.

s.kar:
xás
ník
t óo
kfuukiraa .
s.eng: And he grabbed at it.

s.kar:
xás
ivaxrahá riik
t óo
skákish .
s.eng: But he landed on dry ground.

s.kar:
xás
pa 'íshaha
t u vúunfak .
s.eng: And the water flowed away downhill.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
vúra
xâatik .
s.eng: And he said, "Let it go.

s.kar:
miník
ni 'ísh eesh
kâam ."
s.eng: I'll drink upriver a ways."

s.kar:
xás
u 'árihroov .
s.eng: And he traveled upriver.

s.kar:
xás
u thítiv
pá thuuf
u vúrunih va .
s.eng: And he heard a creek flowing down.

s.kar:
xás
u kvíripship .
s.eng: And he broke into a run.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
pa naní vaas
ni paathkúrih eesh ."
s.eng: And he said, "I'll throw my blanket in the water."

s.kar:
xás
mú vaas
u paathkúrih .
s.eng: And he threw his blanket in.

s.kar:
xás
ámtaap
kích
u kpúpusip .
s.eng: But just dust puffed up.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
chími
u 'ív eesh ,
kóova
t u vaxráhchak .
s.eng: And he was about to die, he was so thirsty.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
payêem
ni vôoruraa vish
pa 'ípaha .
s.eng: And he said, "Now I'll climb a tree.

s.kar:
xasík
pa naní vaas
ni paathkúrih eesh ."
s.eng: Then I'll throw my blanket in the water."

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
u thítiv
pá thuuf .
s.eng: So he heard a creek again.

s.kar:
xás
u chunvákir
vúra
kacha'îimich .
s.eng: And he sneaked up slowly.

s.kar:
xás
á'
u vôoruraa
ípah ak .
s.eng: And he climbed up a tree.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
pa mú vaas
u paathkúrih een .
s.eng: And then he threw his blanket in.

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
vúra
ámtaap
kích
u kpúpusip
p oo kyívish .
s.eng: And again just dust puffed up when it fell.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
uum
hûut
chími
u 'îin eesh ,
pa mú prii
vúra
t u váxrah .
s.eng: What was he to do? His tongue was just dry.

s.kar:
xás
yánava "
tá
ni 'úum
kahyúras ."
s.eng: Then he saw, (he said), "I've reached Klamath Lakes!"

s.kar:
xás
vúra
tá
pu 'áhoo tih ara ,
vúra
t óo
kfuuk tih .
s.eng: And he wasn't walking any more, he was creeping by now.

s.kar:
xás
kári
ikúk ak
ú kfuu kar .
s.eng: And he crept out on a log.

s.kar:
xás
u 'ísh .
s.eng: And he drank.

s.kar:
xás
p oo ptáchvaayship
xás
kúkuum
vúra
u 'ish .
s.eng: After he raised up, he drank again.

s.kar:
xás
vaa
kári
pu p ikvaayshípree ra ,
úuth
ú kyiimkar .
s.eng: Then he couldn't raise up any more, he fell into the river.

s.kar:
xás
u síinvar .
s.eng: And he drowned.

s.kar:
xás
u thívruuhvarak .
s.eng: So he floated down from upriver.

s.kar:
xás
tá
íshyaav .
s.eng: And it was winter by now.

s.kar:
xás
t oo
mah ,
astíip
sah'áhup
kun ikyáa vunaa tih .
s.eng: And he saw, they were gathering driftwood on the shore.

s.kar:
xás
t óo
píip "
ahup yâamach
kan párihish .
s.eng: And he said, "Let me become a pretty stick.

s.kar:
vaa
uum
kana 'êethripaa vish ."
s.eng: Then they'll hook me out."

s.kar:
púyava
tá
kun mah ,
pa 'ahup yâamach
t u thívruuhvarak .
s.eng: Then they saw it, the pretty stick floating down from upriver.

s.kar:
xás
tá
kun píip "
yáxa
pa 'ahup yâamach
t u thívruuhvarak .
s.eng: And they said, "Look at the pretty stick floating down!

s.kar:
chími
nu 'êethripaa ."
s.eng: Let's take it out!"

s.kar:
xás
axmáy
vúra
pa 'áhup
t óo
skaksîip .
s.eng: And suddenly the stick jumped up.

s.kar:
xás
tá
kun píip "
eee !
naa
ni p êesh '
pihnêefich .'
s.eng: And they said, "Ah, I'll bet it's Coyote!

s.kar:
úuth
kiik pí paathkan ."
s.eng: Throw it back into the river!"

s.kar:
púyava
xás
kun pí paathkar .
s.eng: So they threw it back in.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t u thívruuhvarak .
s.eng: So he floated down from upriver.

s.kar:
xás
yurástiim
u thivrúhish .
s.eng: And he floated ashore on the seashore.

s.kar:
xás
mâaka
u thívruuhripaa .
s.eng: He floated up on land.

s.kar:
xás
ú kfuukripaa .
s.eng: And he crawled ashore.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
káan
ára
kun 'áraarahi tih .
s.eng: And he saw people were living there.

s.kar:
yánava
káan
ikmaháchraam
u 'íikra .
s.eng: He saw a sweathouse standing there.

s.kar:
xás
u tfúnuk va .
s.eng: So he looked in.

s.kar:
xás
yánava
éeruun ,
vúra
impuk á ch nih ich .
s.eng: And he saw it was vacant, it was a nice warm place.

s.kar:
xás
ú kfuukfuruk .
s.eng: So he crawled in.

s.kar:
xás
káan
yánava
pa mukun patúmkir
káru
pa mukun 'ikrívkir
athkúrit
u kyâar ahi tih .
s.eng: And he saw there that their pillows and their chairs were made of fat.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t óo
xúriha .
s.eng: And he was hungry.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
u 'áv aheen
pa mukun 'ikrívkir
káru
pa mukun patúmkir .
s.eng: So he ate their chairs and their pillows.

s.kar:
xás
u thafipshîip .
s.eng: He ate them all up.

s.kar:
xás
ahúp maam
kúuk
u 'uum ,
xás
u 'áasish .
s.eng: And he went behind the woodpile, and he lay down.

s.kar:
xás
axmáy
pa 'ávans as
kun pávyiihfuruk .
s.eng: And suddenly the men came in.

s.kar:
yáas
kun pamvára tih .
s.eng: They had just finished eating.

s.kar:
yítha
u píip "
yahé
hôoy
pa naní krivkir ."
s.eng: And one said, "Well, where's my chair?
s.note: There is no closing quote in Bright, but as the next sentence begins another's speech, it must be added.

s.kar:
káru
yítha
u píip "
hôoy
pa nani patúmkir ."
s.eng: and one said, "Where's my pillow?"

s.kar:
xás
kun túraayva .
s.eng: And they looked around.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
puyíthaxay
káan
thaanêe ra .
s.eng: And not one was lying there.

s.kar:
xás
kun píip "
naa
ni p êesh '
pihnêefich .'
s.eng: And they said, "I'll bet it's Coyote.

s.kar:
mít
kun íp aat '
t óo
síinvar
kahyúras .'"
s.eng: They said he drowned at Klamath Lakes."

s.kar:
pihnêefich
vúra
káan
ú yruuhriv ,
púxay
vúra
kêena tih ara .
s.eng: Coyote lay there, he didn't stir.

s.kar:
xás
pa 'ávans as
kun 'arihíshriih vunaa
pa pákurih .
s.eng: And the men sang songs.

s.kar:
xás
kun 'arihíshriih va
vúra
taay .
s.eng: They sang a whole lot.

s.kar:
kun píip "
chími
panamnih pákuri
kiik 'árihish ,
káruma
káan
chími
nú vyiihsipree vish ."
s.eng: And they said, "Sing an Orleans song, we're going there!"

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t u sáyriihva ,
xás
u váxiprishuk ,
xás
âapun
u krivrúhuthun .
s.eng: Then (Coyote) was homesick, and he flopped out, and he rolled around on the ground.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
ayukîi
panámniik ,
nani thívthaaneen ."
s.eng: And he said, "Hello Orleans, my country!"
s.note: Bright: "ayukîi 'hello!' may be used, as here, to address a distant person or place which is thought of nostalgically."

s.kar:
xás
kun píip "
pihnêefich
uum .
s.eng: And they said, "It's Coyote!

s.kar:
úuth
nu pí paathkan ."
s.eng: Throw him in the river!"

s.kar:
xás
ú xrar .
s.eng: Then he cried.

s.kar:
u píip "
pûuhara ,
xáyfaat
úuth
kana pí paathkar .
s.eng: He said, "No, don't throw me in the river.

s.kar:
kii kxúrik eesh ap
yâamachich .
s.eng: I'll paint you pretty.

s.kar:
pa mikun 'axvâa
kii kxúrik eesh ap
yâamachich ."
s.eng: I'll paint your heads pretty."

s.kar:
xás
kun píip "
chémi ."
s.eng: And they said, "All right."

s.kar:
xás
u kxúrik vunaa .
s.eng: So he painted them.
s.note: Bright: "The people whom he painted were ducks" (cf. WB_KL-02); "this episode accounts for their brightly colored heads."

s.kar:
xás
tá
kun ikyáasip
pa vée vyiihship
panámniik .
s.eng: Then they started to leave for Orleans.

s.kar:
xás
pihnêefich
u píip "
chími
kan ip thívkee ."
s.eng: And Coyote said, "Let me go along!"

s.kar:
kun píip "
pûuhara ."
s.eng: And they said, "No!"

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t óo
xrar .
s.eng: Then he cried.

s.kar:
"
kana p ípasroov i ."
s.eng: "Take me back upriver!"

s.kar:
xás
kun píip "
chími
man .
s.eng: Then they said, "All right.

s.kar:
kúna
vúra
i 'asimchák eesh
ík ,
xáyfaat
ík
i txâarihva .
s.eng: But you must close your eyes, you mustn't open them.

s.kar:
yúkun
p ee 'itxâarihv ahaak
ôok
i p ishkákishrih eesh ."
s.eng: If you open your eyes, you will land back here again.

s.kar:
xás
ta'ítam
kun íp viitraa heen .
s.eng: So then they paddled up from downriver.

s.kar:
xás
pihnêefich
uum
ú yruuhriv ,
u 'asímchaak tih .
s.eng: Coyote lay (there), he kept his eyes closed.

s.kar:
xás
vúra
t u 'ûuri
p óo yruuhriv ,
p oo 'asímchaak tih .
s.eng: And he got tired lying (there), keeping his eyes closed.

s.kar:
t u yáavha
pa vá 'iipm a .
s.eng: He was in a hurry to get back (home).

s.kar:
"
káru
hôoy
pa ta nú p viitma ,
kíri
ni mah .
s.eng: "And where have we paddled to? I want to see!"

s.kar:
kíri
vúra
yunâamich
ni 'itxâarihva ."
s.eng: Let me open my eyes just a little!"

s.kar:
xás
vúra
yunâamich
u 'itxâarihva .
s.eng: So he opened his eyes just a little.

s.kar:
xás
yúruk
xás
u pi pmahóonkoon .
s.eng: And he felt (himself) back downriver.

s.kar:
xás
kúkuum
vúra
kun íp viitraa .
s.eng: Then they paddled upriver again.

s.kar:
xás
u píip "
payêem
vúra
pu na 'itxâarihv eesh ."
s.eng: And (Coyote) said, "Now I won't open my eyes."

s.kar:
xás
vúra
kúnish
púfaat
ipmahóonkoon ara .
s.eng: And he sort of didn't feel anything.

s.kar:
xás
axmáy
vúra
u thítiv ,
asámyiith
ú xak .
s.eng: And suddenly he heard it, the gravel sounded.

s.kar:
xás
pá paah
kun ithyúruripaa .
s.eng: And they hauled the boat ashore.

s.kar:
xás
kun ipêer
pihnêefich "
ôok
uum
panámniik ."
s.eng: And they told Coyote, "Here's Orleans."

s.kar:
xás
kári
vúra
u 'aachíchha ,
xás
u krivrúhuthun ,
úuth
u piytúykaan va
pá yuux .
s.eng: Then he was happy, and he rolled around, and he kicked the dirt out into the river.

s.kar:
púyava
kúth
uum
p oo tíshraam hi ti
panámniik .
s.eng: That's why there is a flat at Orleans.

s.kar:
púyava
páy
uum
pihnêefich
u kúphaa nik .
s.eng: This is what Coyote did.
